Reviews.Title: “Great location. Average hotel.”
Reviews.Author: amennyc
Reviews.Content: Location can't be beat. East, West, North, South... there is plenty to do. Employees are super amazing and kind. Professional and NYC great. Hotel is very Holiday Inn feeling. One could easily stay here as it was clean, just moderate in decor. Wouldn't recommend more than a few nights.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel & Staff!”
Reviews.Author: tlmoreau71
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel using Expedia.ca 2 days before arriving. Was a bit nervous at first but thought "it's a room with a bed and a shower so it can't be that bad". When we arrived around noon, they quickly grabbed our luggage and said they would secure it for us while we toured around the Financial District. We came back around 6, and even though our room wasn't quite ready, the staff were fantastic. They apologized multiple times and quickly got it ready for us. We went upstairs and the maid service was wonderful as they were finishing up our room. And once in we were shocked at how nice it really was. It had alot more room than what we expected and the bed was comfortable. There was even a mini-fridge and microwave to our surprise! The location of this hotel is ideal, as it's almost right in China Town and Little Italy. Lots of good shops as well on Broadway and Wholesome Foods almost right beside it. Our taxi driver picked us up and we were at the airport in less than 25 min! All in all, this was a fantastic hotel for the price we paid and I would highly recommend it to anyone visiting NYC!

Reviews.Title: “Great staff”
Reviews.Author: IcebarOslo
Reviews.Content: Stayed here a week last september for a buisiness trip. The staff at the hotel was excellent but had some issues with the room(s). First room had a broken shower, second broken AC. It was however a nice stay, mostly because the staff at this hotel is really friendly and helpful!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: nancy b
Reviews.Content: My husband and I returned to New York ,to attend a wedding, after having moved away 20 years ago. We wanted a hotel near our old neighborhood to be able to revisit our old haunts. The Gem fit the bill! To start we were anxious because the wedding was at 3:30 and check-in wasn't until 3:00. I had requested an early check-in but was unsure until we arrived at 1:00 and we were told that since our room wasn't ready they had upgraded us to a room with fridge and microwave at no additional cost and that it was all set for us...2 hours early! The room was much bigger than we had expected, clean, bright, huge comfy bed and clean bath with great hot water. The entire staff was friendly and low key right up through check -out where we chatted with Jose at the front desk about how great it was to be back in NYC. The Gem is in a great location for getting around the Lower East Side, West Village, Little Italy and Chinatown. Construction on 2nd Ave was going on just below our window(we were on the 3rd floor), but didn't bother us at all.

Reviews.Title: “Great locations for bars and restaurants; superb receptionists!”
Reviews.Author: DionLondon
Reviews.Content: Positives - front desk staff really can't do more to help you...superb service - location is perfect if you want to be in a lively area with loads of bars and restaurants in walking distance - rooms are clean and bed comfortable..this is good value for NYC (as compared to Marriott Courtyard which at $300 does nothing to merit a premium on the GEM Soho!) Negatives - my room was on the ground floor which meant not only could I hear people talking in reception, but could also hear the NY traffic. This didn't really bother me because I wasn't in NY to sleep!

Reviews.Title: “GEMtastic!”
Reviews.Author: Chuck B
Reviews.Content: Was lucky enough to find an amazing rate on the Iphone/Android app "Hotel Tonight" and for the rate, I didn't expect anything special. Well, I was first impressed with Keith's (front desk) warmth and efficiency. I was then happy to discover a decent sized, bright and tastefully decorated room with a large flat screen tv with a great picture. A comfy bed, useful desk, coffee maker (with Wolfgang Puck coffee), iron and board rounded out with special treats including a "Gem stone" to indicate if you would like fresh linens (and later to keep as a souvenir) and even a vial of sleep/relax inducing lavender oil were all part of the deal. The restroom was spotless and included thick white towels and a host of Gilchrist and Soames products for the beauty in you. The neighborhood is hip and you'll find restaurants and bars galore--an indie movie theater and Whole Foods are right next door. This morning I was cheerfully greeted by Luis as well as the Manager who were also genuinely interested in the comfort of my stay. Keep in mind--this is not a luxury hotel, but rather it is a small hotel that gets the simple concept of comfort right on target. Interesting touches such as phone messaged neighborhood tours and recommendations, the Gem stone, and lavender oil added a splash of special. Great value.

Reviews.Title: “Place is worthy”
Reviews.Author: Hdf001
Reviews.Content: The hotel by itself is ok, but it is located in a very nice place to take transportation or, the best, walk around. You can go north or south very easy near by Broadway. Rooms are pretty small, do no take so much stuff with you and try to be upstairs.

Reviews.Title: “Great Alternative Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Albanyscotty
Reviews.Content: I was very pleased with my stay at the GEM Soho. The rooms were comfortable, clean and stylish. Its on a busy corner but was surprisingly quiet....probably well insulated windows. A quick walk to all Soho venues. And price was great!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: weewinkie
Reviews.Content: When we arrived, Anthony at the front desk could not have been more welcoming and helpful. As everyone else has mentioned, the location is steps from the subway and lots of restaurants, etc. And, as others have mentioned, the room was small (and the heater a little noisy), but the room was completely clean and the bed was good. The room overlooked Sara Roosevelt Park and we loved it. It was very good value for the money, and we would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Very good price/quality”
Reviews.Author: Laura J
Reviews.Content: It was a pleasure to stay at the GEM hotel. The staff is really helpful, the location is great (all the good shops, cafes/tearooms, supermarket etc), subway around the corner, CLEAN AND GOOD beds. There might not be a closed but there are several drawers underneath the bed plus, wich is fine. There is btw also a strecher to put your luggage on. I will definitly come back and recommend it to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay for our girls weekend”
Reviews.Author: Krissi55
Reviews.Content: The hotel is right between East Village and SOHO, perfect location for us with plenty of good bars and restaurants around, and also few breakfast places. We shared the room with 3 girls which was ok, but bit small with our luggague. The beds were comfy but room in overall very basic. The aircon/heater was a bit strange, bit too big for the size of the room and either it was too hot or too cold. Anthony at the dask was def a great help with all his recommendations for bars and restaurants around!! The only real complain is that we also had pot-smoking/drunk guys next to our room which even partied through the whole night and the night shift couldn't really handle them even after we called them several times. After the second night complaining, they finally called the police in the morning as it got worse and worse with them, you could smell the pot even in our rooms and doors smashing through the whole night.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location....”
Reviews.Author: Traveltheworldfun
Reviews.Content: My room on the 6th floor was a great size, and I loved the bed. The staff is stellar at cool botique hotel, its funky but still sophisticated....

Reviews.Title: “Loved This Place”
Reviews.Author: PhillyMc2012
Reviews.Content: Took a chance on a recommendation on twitter and showed up to The Gem slightly nervous having not checked it out properly. I needn't have worried. This place is a real treat. Right by the East Village, SoHo and Broadway - this was a perfect location for me (great bars, breakfast joints and restaurants). It's right beside the F train subway which makes Brooklyn and JFK really handy. The room was big (for New York) with a really well fitted out bathroom. Loved the little touches of hand written welcome note, bathroom accessaory's and lavendar oil by the pillow to aid sleep. A little personality goes a long way in my book. Great shower, free wifi and a safe for valuables. The bed was comfy - wasn't crazy on the soft pillows, but that's a matter of taste. I found the air con/heater a little full on for the size of the room v's size of machine, but I ended up not using it at all. Both Jose & Anthony on the desk were bright, friendly and informative but top marks go to the chamber staff who did an excellent job, went to a lot of trouble when I needed something and checked in with me before they left for the day to see if i needed anything - you don't get that kind of service in big chain hotels. As you can see - I had a great stay here. I'll be back. Best place for breakfast close by is REMEDY on the corner of E Houston & Essex Thanks GEM!

Reviews.Title: “Overall a great hotel. Staff could not handle unruly pot-smoking guests.”
Reviews.Author: patroclus_dc
Reviews.Content: Overall the day staff was great and friendly, but the night staff did not handle unruly pot-smoking/drunk college students. The aforementioned would head to the roof, slamming the door to the staircase constantly with open containers The hallways reek of pot, and the disturbance forced us to leave the room at 12:30 am. When we returned at 2:30 am, the same activity was occurring; door slamming and stoned/drunk 20-something's stumbling through the halls.

Reviews.Title: “A great place!”
Reviews.Author: monkeyontheroad
Reviews.Content: I grew up in NYC and always feel a bit insane returning and paying for a hotel. Gem is a fantastic find. I stayed there in October while on business in the city. The location is great. A short walk to lower east side galleries, the New Museum, and SOHO restaurants. Prune, one of the city's greatest dining spots is just one block away. There is a new coffee shop just one block west on the south side of Houston that serves fantastic espresso and gourmet doughnuts. Two blocks to the east is Russ and daughters for a delicious bialy and caviar cream cheese! The staff was amazingly gracious and helpful. The room was very clean and cozy. I am a terrible insomniac, but slept through the night peacefully, aided by a very comfortable bed and cute touches like the aromatherapy pillow scents... I will definitely return to Gem on my next trip to the city!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, basic hotel”
Reviews.Author: scotinexile90
Reviews.Content: The Soho Gem did what I needed on my business trip - neat and tidy room, everything worked and a very comfortable bed. A little bit off the beaten track in relation to the subway network and I should have specified not to have a room overlooking Houston Street as it's pretty noisy, but otherwise certainly recommended as a value for money option in NYC. All the staff I encountered were friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: zgrrl74
Reviews.Content: We only planned to stay for two nights in NYC, so location was everything when looking for a place to stay. The Gem is perfectly situated just off Bowery with plenty of shopping and eating experiences within a short walking distance. The rooms are clean with a modern look and the beds big and comfy. There was no minibar or water boiler in our room. The staff are friendly, but not pushy, the perfect combination. They also have a blackboard in the lobby with staff picks on what to do, where to eat and so on. We were travelling with an infant and the rooms aren't very big so not perfect for a stroller, but this isn't billed as a family hotel, so we were prepared and since there is a working elevator everything was OK. All in all I would definitely come back, alone or with my family!

Reviews.Title: “friendliest hotel staff in NY”
Reviews.Author: jess h
Reviews.Content: Anthony and Keith you made our holiday stay the best! This hotel I would recommend mainly for the friendliness of the staff. They were great and every day always had great recommendations of places to eat/see. If you had a problem with the room- theyd fix it. Sure the rooms are small but I was purely there to sleep and shower and this did just the trick. Its in a great location and was never more than a $15 cab ride from anything.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in brilliant neighbourhood location”
Reviews.Author: BD75London
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel twice now and would return again. It's downtown location on the Lower East Side couldn't be better. It is a 2 min walk to the great bars and restaurants on Ludlow st. The other way it is a short walk to Soho. The hotel is no frills in the respect it doesn't have a bar but you really don't need one. Rooms are great - again we're not talking high spec design but super comfy beds and good showers. There is a huge Wholefoods opp the hotel where you can get breakfast if you want something simpler than the big breakfast places. If you want to stay in a part of town where you feel like you are living in an actual neighbourhood rather than a tourist area then this is for you. If you want to be close to all the iconic NY sights such as the Empire State then you should stay in midtown. The front desk staff are really helpful and friendly - they make it a great stay. This hotel really is a gem.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and fantastic staff!”
Reviews.Author: cposs
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend booked a trip to NYC for my birthday, and he tried to balance finding a nice hotel that was reasonably priced (by New York standards) with a great location. This was the perfect hotel for that. The hotel is in a great neighborhood with lots of shopping, restaurants, and cafes nearby, and it is conveniently located near the subway as well. The hotel itself is very cute. The rooms are on the small side (but I imagine that's true of most rooms in New York at this price point). But they are very clean, bright with lots of light, and a big window overlooking the city. The best part of the stay was definitely the staff who were incredibly friendly and very helpful with our stay. Keith was works at the front desk was very helpful and wanted to make sure we had a great stay. We also met the general manager who was very friendly as well. They even left me a happy birthday note in my room, which made my day. I would highly recommend the GEM hotel. We plan on staying there again next time we go back.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: xxx_282
Reviews.Content: I was shocked when I arrived at the hotel. It's old and dark and just needs a re-furb badly. The rooms are TINY!!!!!!!!!! My husband and I could barely fit out suitcases in the room...1 we couldn't even unpack because there was no floor space. The bathroom is also TINY!!!!!!!!! The rooms smell old and musty. The aircon is so loud and ours was burning is at 4am we had to switch it off and sweat through the rest of the night. They didn't even have any scales so we could weigh our luggage. The windows are not double glazed so it was hard to sleep with all the noise on the street and the taxi's tooting. Plus, I just arrived back home and there is a charge on my credit card when we didn't use anything in the room. When I checked out the guy at reception even said that we didn't owe anything. So now I'm chasing up what the charge is. So not worth the money staying at The Gem Hotel in Soho. As we were checking out there was another complaint from a guest wanting to change rooms because her room was too small.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, personal service”
Reviews.Author: CologneMonster
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel and it was an excellent choice. I loved the location of the hotel inbetween the Lower East Side and SoHo. Much nicer than the hotels around Times Square, good shopping and Eating nearby. The hotel is just next to a Subway Station. I would recommend it to everybody. Try to get a room not at the same story as the reception.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful staff, nice location”
Reviews.Author: Horizontal_Sleeper
Reviews.Content: If you are a kind who uses the hotel room just for taking showers and sleeping, this is the right one for you. If I am visiting a city for touristic purposes, I expect the hotel I will stay to be close to major attractions or public transportation, safe (since I usually leave the room early and return late), and clean. The Gem Soho was really satisfactory for me, especially when I consider the price. Location is great, walking distance to Little Italy and Soho and close to two different subway stations. They do not offer breakfast but there are a lot of Deli's in the neighborhood, so it was not a major problem. Bed was really comfortable with lots of pillows, sheets and towels were changed everyday, therefore it was clean. Staff was really helpful and concerned. Provided several maps for us, gave tips about the neighborhood, and arranged out transportation to the airport. They deserve great appreciation. Windows were not open-able which was the only problem I got. If you want to have some fresh air, you have to leave your door open.

Reviews.Title: “Not Clean! Smells like mold!”
Reviews.Author: MCK1000
Reviews.Content: This hotel looks okay from the pictures, but the updated decor is a cover up for how dirty this place is. It completely smells like mold and everything in the rooms is broken. It's kind of a dump. I'd call it a motel rather than a hotel. It's also very noisy!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, decent price”
Reviews.Author: Condolla
Reviews.Content: Having once lived in New York and having had a nice apartment to go back to at the end of the night, I never really knew how expensive hotels were there until I moved away and came back to visit. Lord. They are expensive! That's why I was very happy to find the GEM in Soho - well, really it's kinda more Nolita / LES, but who's counting. If you plan to spend more of your time in NYC downtown, the GEM is perfectly situated for hanging out anywhere downtown. You are within walking distance of some of the best restaurants in the city (that is, if you prefer cozy restaurants that produce excellent food over trying to get into the big name restaurants in the City...trust me, the food quality is not so different). You're also close to some fantastic shopping areas. And, if you want to head to Brooklyn, the bridge is just a hop, skip, and a jump away. The rooms are on the compact side, but what hotel rooms under $500 a night in NYC aren't? Are you really going there to sit in your room? No, no you are not, especially if you're doing NYC right. So, go to the GEM, get a good price on a clean, nicely furnished room, and enjoy all that New York has to offer!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: WineSnob7
Reviews.Content: Room wasn't quite right and didn't get maid service, but they did make up for it. Very friendly staff and location which helped a lot.

Reviews.Title: “Place promised a lot delivered very little”
Reviews.Author: Ambassador3d
Reviews.Content: They put us in a basement room. When we complained they said " next time tell the you don't want the basement" really???

Reviews.Title: “Great location and great Staff”
Reviews.Author: crpics
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel in a super convenient location. This is a small hotel, small rooms, big heart. While we only got one of the two rooms exactly as we booked, the staff went out of their way to help us switch rooms the next day. The rooms had a few quirks, tv didn't work easily and had to be re-programed every time you turned it on. The iron didn't work but they brought a new one. They forgot to put the robes and water in the room but quickly brought it up. The shower didn't have a lot of power to it. Now on the plus; the beds were super comfortable and the pillows were awesome and lots of them. The staff and the girls cleaning the rooms could not do enough for you and help you with recommendations. There is a Whole Foods down a block to the west, and a place called Sugars, down a block to the east. Sugars is a 24 hour bakery, gelato, breakfast, lunch, whatever place that is awesome! Katz deli is also a few blocks to the east. I would stay here again in a hearbeat. Book early for great rates. I paid 250 for the delux 2 double bed park view, microwave and fridge. The rate while we were there was over 500 if you booked that week. Worth up to around 300 but I wouldn't pay more. Great place.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and fabulous staff”
Reviews.Author: mrswilliams123
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights with a friend in a decent sized room on the top floor overlooking East Houston. The room was perfectly acceptable and had two full sized double beds, which were very comfertable and extremely inviting after a long day sightseeing! The bathroom was small but useful, with all the essentials, although they may need to look at providing non-slip mats in the bath as I managed to slip whilst showering, falling out and hitting my head on the toilet! The staff here are what really makes the place. They were very helpful and genuinely friendly - I would not have rated the hotel as highly without them. The location was excellent - two subway stations a stonesthrow away, lots of good bars and restaurants in the immediate vicinity, including Katz's deli, although this place should probably be visited for kitsch value rather than the quality of the food! Overall a great base for exploring NYC - this is where you want to be if you're in the city for decent night life as well as sightseeing, and as the hotel isn't as ridiculously overpriced as some in Manhattan, you can spend the pennies you saved drinking delicious cocktails instead!

Reviews.Title: “A Great experience”
Reviews.Author: vbery
Reviews.Content: We recently completed our 2 week trip to the USA, and our last hotel stay was @ GEM SOHO. Normally when u are told Boutique Hotel your expectations of everything drops. We were very pleasantly surprised, in the quality of the fixtures/fittings in the room. to the level of cleanliness, and to the friendly quality of the staff. It is one of the best hotels we stayed in USA and if we re visit NY, will definitely stay there.

Reviews.Title: “A terrible hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nissim65
Reviews.Content: We stayed 6 nights in this terrible hotel. We strongly recommend avoiding this hotel. There is no correlation between the description and nice photos presented at the hotel website and the actual hotel. We stayed with 4 kids. When making the reservation we specifically insisted to have 2 connected rooms. When arrived at night, we realized that we were allocated with two different rooms, and that in fact the hotel does not at all have connected rooms. The personnel were rude, not helpful, uncooperative and refused our request to cancel the reservation as we were willing to move to another hotel, although the late hour and the trouble involved. Rooms are small, basic, not equipped and there is constant smell of cleaning and disinfection materials all over.

Reviews.Title: “NYC Gem”
Reviews.Author: Vilmalidia
Reviews.Content: I usually read reviews before I book any hotel... also I really enjoy to stay in hotels that are not big chain... Guess what? this one it was not the exception!! A lot of people wrote good reviews and few wrote no good reviews.. but the Majority reviews convicen me to give a chance ...and I did ... First the staff is " Awsome", very helpful with directions,very friendly. The hotel location is great.. close to everything.. train station, parks, restaurants, coffee shops, taxi, bus, etc, etc... About the inside... Well is a Boutique Hotel... Rooms are small, but the beds and pillows are "comfy".. have free internet, the bathrooms small.... but really you are in Vacation in NYC... you don't need a big bathroom or a big room... Overall I don't have any complaint about this hotel.... Good Luck!

Reviews.Title: “We would not recommend it...”
Reviews.Author: Jens K
Reviews.Content: We did not expect much and we were aware that this is not the Ritz. We chose this hotel because of the rather cheap rates for NYC and booked it for one week. However, although the staff was very friendly, the hotel and its rooms are not very nice. We arrived on one of the hottest days in NYC end of July. We were offered a "free upgrade" to room 602, which was right under the roof top and extremely hot. The AC was broken - although we were told it was new and installed just the day before we came - and the carpet was moist and wet. This led to an incredible smell and gave us a headache after not even 5 minutes. After complaining we were offered a room in the basement, which was smelling similar bad and is complpetely unacceptable. The room looked more like a prison cell than a hotel room. In the end we were given another room which was acceptable, but it was free only for one night. And given that fact that two rooms offered were not tolerable, we decided to move to antoher hotel after the first night. We did not want to take any risk. The location is nice and the staff was indeed trying to help. But I did get the feeling that they knew all too well that the room (602) had the problems before offering us the "upgrade". It is not a bad hotel, and if you are used to East European standards you will not have a problem. The bathroom was clean and nice. The beds were comfortable. However, all rooms and the hallway had a really bad smell. If you want to be able to relax in the rooms and actually enjoy your stay, dont go here.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place in good location”
Reviews.Author: tmh03
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights, the first night in a basement room which I did not care for without a window. My request the next morning to be moved upstairs was complied with and when I got back to my room that evening I had been given a nicely updated room overlooking Houston. Stayed there 2 nights and overall this is a well updated place in a good location. I was working in the Financial District and it was an easy walk to the subway at Broadway and Houston. Also, the desk clerks were very nice and had great ideas for dinner and breakfast (Sugar for breakfast, Luciens for dinner). Overall a pleasant and comfortable stay.

Reviews.Title: “A " fake gem"”
Reviews.Author: Ala57
Reviews.Content: Although friendly staff, rooms are way too tiny! Impossible to open up completely the door of the room. No space for the suitcases. Overpriced for what it is. Problem with elevator when we were there. We will definitely not come back and certainlynot recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Small, but the staff are friendly”
Reviews.Author: MelAust
Reviews.Content: The reception staff are very friendly and helpful. The location is good - right near subway and Soho shopping district. There is also a wholefoods market across the street which is great for lunches / dinner. Lots of bars and clubs nearby. The only negative points is that the cleaning service could be a little better and the rooms are very small. But all in all, excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “Should be called the Sham Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dshlachter
Reviews.Content: Gem Hotel? More like Sham Hotel. They claim to offer "stunning boutique accommodations," which I suppose is quite true in the literal sense. Upon arrival, we were certainly "stunned" (i.e., shocked and temporarily unable to react) when we learned that room 701 was not on the 7th floor, but was in fact underground. By using seven as a euphemism for negative one, the Sham Hotel demonstrates just how "boutique" it is: in the most literal sense of the word, they "appeal to a sophisticated and specialized clientele" that can afford a dark cell at $300/night and happens to be a subterranean creature. This group is so specialized that only two of them exist: Sonic the Hedgehog and Bilbo Baggins. When we opened the door, we expected it to lead directly into a subway station. After realizing that we would be deprived of that convenience, we explored the "park view," which was actually a worm's eye view of a thuggish basketball court where some tweaked out spectators were packing god knows what into their little glass pipes. After a 12 hour flight, all I wanted to do was take a shower and charge my phone. Unfortunately, when I tried to turn on the shower, the handle popped right out of the socket and sat listlessly in my palm. When I went to plug in my phone, the outlet in the middle of the wall had some catty wampus orientation that I'd never seen in any country in the world, and thus could not deliver a single electron to my battery. Avoid it at all costs. This Gem is no diamond in the rough; it's Cubic Zirconia in dog s**t.

Reviews.Title: “It was perfect for the price”
Reviews.Author: frieda-f
Reviews.Content: The GEM is a nice little hotel in a good location on East Houston, just a block or so off Bowery. If you want to experience Soho, little Italy, Chelsea, the Village, etc., it's a great place to stay. Hotel was really clean and the staff were all super nice. Yes, housekeeping did clean the rooms way too late in the day (4 - 5 pm), but for the price we paid ($159) I can live with that. The rooms are quite small, but they use the space very efficiently and the beds are really comfy (like Hilton comfy). The only other issue with the hotel is that it IS right on Houston and there is quite a bit of street noise (horns mostly). For that reason, I may try to find a place in a quieter location, but I imagine beating the Gem's price would be hard to do. Bring earplugs and spend the money you save on food and shopping! One more thing - if you need to park, ask the desk for the garage they use - we saved about $25 using their suggestion.

Reviews.Title: “This GEM is no GEM”
Reviews.Author: KBRSmith
Reviews.Content: This may be a lengthy review, but read it and you'll be thankful you did I promise. First off, let me say that I travel to New York frequently so I know what to expect when it comes to prices/rooms/etc. I normally stay at the W up near Times Square, but my daughter really wanted to stay in the SoHo area and not a "chain" hotel. Since this was my daughter's first time experiencing New York, I thought I'd let her have her way for a night... NEVER again! Let me say, this area is not as hip/fun as this hotel prices it out to be. I paid almost $300 to stay here on a Friday night. Typical NY price so that was not a big deal to me until I saw the room. We were placed in the basement, which we were not told until we got there. The room had one itty bitty window. A window that nobody, not even my very skinny daughter, would be able to get through if a fire broke out in the building. The room itself was also a closet (but most NY rooms are). I immediately went to the desk to complain about the fire hazard, closet room, and price. We waited almost 20 minutes while the desk clerk was on the phone with another VERY unhappy customer. After he was done taking the call, the desk worker said there rooms are first come first serve. I reserved the room WAY in advance so I had a hard time believing that story. What also bothered me is that he offered no solutions whatsoever. The next day we asked for the desk to call us a cab to take us to the Park Central Hotel (way better hotel for the money- we got a room on Sat. night for $200 with a view of Times Square). The desk said he'd call the hotel's driver. This guy was in a car that was unmarked, had no cab meter, and had a huge coke nail. On top of that he drove like a maniac. And I'm not an anti-texter while driving, but when you're going as fast as this guy was driving and texting... it does not make a customer feel safe, but then again neither does the huge coke nail. I know that some people rated this hotel good- they must not have been in the basement (but isn't that a scary risk to take)? Listen to my review when I say it's not worth it. Every time I entered or left this hotel I saw other people complaining at the desk. I would NEVER recommend this hotel/robbery/scam to anyone. Take your money elsewhere. This GEM is no GEM.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, friendly and conveniant”
Reviews.Author: Emfromoz
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week in may/ June for our first ever trip to NYC. From the word go the staff, particularly Anthony and Kieth, made us welcome and were always on hand to offer advice and answer our questions. Rooms were small but very clean and very comfy beds. Would definately return

Reviews.Title: “I won´t be back”
Reviews.Author: Cristina C
Reviews.Content: I did a prepaid reservation for 08 days. When i got home, in Brazil, I realized that they´d charged again on my credit card improperly. I wrote an email and called the hotel, asking them to fix it and send me a document confirming that they had charged wrongly, because i needed it to send to my credit card, but they never send me anything until now.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away! Run away! Rooms in the wet cellar”
Reviews.Author: Traveling1259
Reviews.Content: Unbelievable!!! Believe all of the reviews about getting stuck in the cellar. Moldy smelly. Wet. Unfortunately everything else is booked in NYC. So glad we only booked one night! We are out of here.

Reviews.Title: “Don't get stuck in the basement”
Reviews.Author: 1742traveller
Reviews.Content: Be the last to check in and that's what happens as they allocate rooms first come first serve. I had to stand on the bed to turn the air conditioner off which is wedged in the tiny window at the top of the wall so you feel a bit like you are in a dungeon. To be fair they moved me after the first night but I now have bruises on both legs as the rooms are tiny and I kept walking into the bed frame which really sticks out (I wasn’t alone in this!). That said it’s in a good spot, it’s reasonably priced and it’s perfectly clean.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel and great location”
Reviews.Author: sbchamps
Reviews.Content: My son (6) and I checked in last Sunday and found the hotel to be great. The location is excellent and was walking distance to almost everything we wanted to do. The staff was terrific and accomodating. The room was clean and comfortable. If you're looking for a smaller hotel in a great location the Gem is it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff but small rooms”
Reviews.Author: Beccarino
Reviews.Content: This was the perfect location to stay for my daughter's graduation from the New School. We were walking distance to her apt in the East Village and a longer walk to the University. The staff were really nice and helpful. My brother and wife were able to get the last room at 151 Houston a block away for $50 more/night (Gem was full), and that had a nice roof terrace for us to hang out on, with wonderful views of the city. Even though we arrived a few hours early and at first were told we couldn't get into our room and were starting to check our bags, the reception clerk told us that there actually was a room and it was on the top floor--6th floor--which he told us was a very good thing. That was much appreciated. The room itself was very clean and did have a table and ethernet connection (also free wireless) for my husband to work at. But the room was cramped. The "closet" space was just a few hangers behind a panel. The worst problem was that both my husband and I ended up with multiple bruises and scrapes on our legs and feet from tripping over the bedframe--because of the smallness of the room and the hard wooden frame all around the bed. We expect the rooms to be small, but not to be consistently writhing in pain over bumping into the bed. The city was noisy at night--which kept my husband up a bit, but I slept really well. Beds were very comfy. The other small annoyance was that, even though we would put the dirty towels on the floor, the supply would not be replenished by housekeeping. Only when we had ALL the towels on the floor on the 2nd to last day did we get our towels replenished. We were down to very few at that point. Those downsides notwithstanding, this was an excellent stay and a good value for the $.

Reviews.Title: “Never again GEM hotel”
Reviews.Author: lenusvyat
Reviews.Content: Make sure you are not staying in the basement rooms – they try to trick you by numbering these rooms starting with #7. I had my hopes up but found my room in the basement with almost no window, broken cabinet, only 2 hangers, and, worst of all, the small window was facing right onto a busy street. Every night around 3am, the noise from the street was unbearable and it lasted for about an hour. Not sure if they do cleaning outside or it’s just people coming out of bars. Never again, GEM hotel, at least, not in the basement rooms. p.s. the room really was unbelievably tiny p.p.s. and I am a preferred member of the Comfort Inn chain…

Reviews.Title: “safety box charge”
Reviews.Author: travelxiii
Reviews.Content: We had been staying this hotel over 3 years. We like the location. However, we somehow did not enjoy that much as before this time. First off, the room we stayed was very noisy because the layout of the room that the bed is right next to the window. Secondly, they did not provide hand soap. We had to use shower gel or the facial soap. And the most surprising us we found later in our credit card statement that we were charged extra $6 dollars. We phoned to the hotel and they replied that it was safety box charge, $2 per day. We had never heard there is safety box charge. We did not argue with the staff ( in fact, the staffs there are very nice and helpful). But come on!!!! The another alternatives is Hotel East Houston, just one block east of The Gem.

Reviews.Title: “You can't dream of a better location”
Reviews.Author: WontonPruedleSoup
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Gem hotel for 0 days in September. The hotel staff were extremely helpful and friendly. The room was small but expected for NYC and most importantly the room was very clean without that overbearing chemical/ faux floral smell. The only complaint was that the air conditioner was loud and at that time of year it was really warm at night. The location was one of the best. Right on the cusp of East Village, LES and a short walk across to Soho. We had never been to NYC and wanted to explore the lower cooler end so this was perfect. So many restaurants, bars and shops nearby it was easy to go back to the hotel for a refresh or regroup.

Reviews.Title: “Super alternative to midtown”
Reviews.Author: Phlipg
Reviews.Content: Fab hotel in a great location with excellent staff. Be aware rooms are really small but if you're planning on exploring then you'll only be sleeping here so not a big deal. 2nd Ave subway less than a 100m walk so ideal. Plenty of eating places in the area. Try 'Sugars' for breakfast soooo much more pleasant than Katz. Staff made such an effort knowing it was my 40th birthday. Having stayed elsewhere in NY would come back here. Generally a tad less frantic neighbourhood.

Reviews.Title: “Don't think will stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Pinksp
Reviews.Content: I shortlisted this hotel coz of 2 reasons - (1) all the reviews were brilliant (2) free internet. However, the property did not meet my expectation at all ! It is a brilliant location ie. very close to Soho/Broadway and probably thats the reason I stayed on here. There was no B'fast available (which I was aware of) but no restaurant as well ! The property looked very different from the pictures on internet. The entry has a small door and the the lift almost didnt work. The lift was dirty and quite scary as well ! The rooms are very very small and just enough for one person and 2 would be a crowd ! The air conditioner in the room was very noisy and kept waking me up all night. The staff (Jose) was very helpful and that was one of the plus points other than location.

Reviews.Title: “I will stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: ddempsey
Reviews.Content: We celebrated a birthday in Manhattan for the weekend and stayed at the Gem SoHo. Yes, the rooms are small, but VERY clean and comfortable. It's location on E. Houston is great. If you are looking for some leisurely time in the village, it's a perfect place. Easy to come and go while you are walking around. I corresponded with Jaidev before our trip that it was a birthday celebration. He and the staff added the extra little touches to welcome us and make it special! Thank you to all of you, especially Anthony. We had a great time and will definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “The Gem is Gem”
Reviews.Author: Lyndytes
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a wow, first night we stayed the tv remote was not not working so they moved us to another bigger room with a fridge and microwave, nothing was too much of a problem to them. Room are compact but ideal for what we needed, they are very clean and the beds are to die for soooooooooooo comfy. All the staff are a credit to the hotel. wow

Reviews.Title: “Loved this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelerint1
Reviews.Content: Words cannot describe my stay. Very friendly and helpful staff. Room was very clean. An overall great experience. We will be sure to come back.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel - Brill Location”
Reviews.Author: joi_haworth
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for the one night and I will definately stay there the next time we're in NYC. The staff were incredibly friendly and helpful. The room was an ok-size however we spent so little time in there it was no bother. It was clean and tidy and had a super shower. The location was fantastic for exploring Greenwich Village - everything was in walking distance. If you're looking to spend time in New York downtown I'd reccommend this lovely hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel in a brilliant area of NYC”
Reviews.Author: Don-Rinser
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in Sept 2009. Friendly staff (especially Anthony) and a great little hotel in a less touristy area of NYC. Lots of dive bars and restaurants close by. Cinema next door. Katz deli just down the road. East Village and Lower East Side right on your door step - plus there's a subway/undeground within 2 or 3 mins walk. Go to Whole Foods for breakfast - you'll thank me later. The rooms are a little small but thats NYC hotels for you. Highly recommended! I love NYC and can't wait to go back there =)

Reviews.Title: “Small room but awesome location at a great price”
Reviews.Author: VAtraveler035
Reviews.Content: This was my boyfriend's first trip to NYC so we planned a 5 night trip full of sight-seeing and visiting friends. We got a great deal on this hotel, just under $200/night which was a lot less than any others we were looking at. When we checked in, the front desk guy was very friendly. He told us our room number was 705 which we assumed would be on the 7th floor but was actually in the basement. The room was tiny but that didn't mean too much to us because we didn't plan to spend too much time there. There was a small window where we could see the ankles of the people passing on the street. The room was clean and the bathroom was surprisingly a decent size. Also, free WiFi! The best part of the hotel was the location. We were close to 2 different subway lines which got us just about everywhere we needed to be. There is a huge Whole Foods grocery store very close where we could get snacks and drinks. Lots of restaurants and bars within walking distance. Overall, I would say if you are just looking for a cheap, clean place to sleep in a great location, you can't do better than this hotel. However, if you plan to spend large amounts of time in the room and like lots of large-chain hotel amenities, you will be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: leetlesasa
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a few days while joining a friend on her apartment hunt and getting in some shopping in the area. Small hotel, can be easy to miss if your driver isnt too familiar with the area. Tiny, tiny lobby but check-in was quick and the clerk was pretty friendly and chatty. The room and bathroom are quite small, but if you plan on being out & about its not a big deal since there's just enough room for 1-2 people. My room was on an upper floor and had a nice view of Houston/Chrystie, and theres always a light humm of traffic (its NY afterall) but it wasnt much of an issue. Plenty of soft towels in the bathroom, which is always nice, especially when you're getting ready in a rush and dont want to miss dinner reservations :) There is a huge Whole Foods Market at Chrystie, perfect for grabbing a bottle of wine (or two :) before heading out to dinner. Gem is close to Soho shopping during the day and E Village bars at night - the location really is perfect for the area and so is the price!~

Reviews.Title: “Good experience”
Reviews.Author: GojuRyupt
Reviews.Content: The first night spent in the room that is in the basement, I asked to move to other room, and so was, the rooms are clean, there is a little street noise but we are in NYC I liked the room taking into account my needs , wi-fi acceptable, near the subway, and food shops, across the street there is a Whole Foods Market is excellent and we can bring food to the room unfortunately my room had no refrigerator. It was a good room for the amount charged in NYC

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Location”
Reviews.Author: ParksyMelb
Reviews.Content: The Gem is amazingly situated between Soho, East Village and the Lower East Side. The hotel is clean and basic, but very comfortable with extremely approachable and friendly front desk staff. Priced as NYC hotels are, you pay more than in other cities, but it is simply worth in for the location, and a little pricacy in the heart of the worlds greatest city.

Reviews.Title: “Fun location; best staff!”
Reviews.Author: J-biztraveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights in Sept for a business trip/visiting friends. The good: Starting at check-in, the staff here were super-nice, genuinely caring, funny, and attentive! Issues I ran into that they totally helped with: 1. connecting my iPad to the free wifi (they had an iPad at the front desk so they knew how to use one!) 2. ceiling light went out (they changed it right away) 3. adding on an extra night (allowed me to stay in the room even before payment for the extra night was secured) 4. crazy-loud jackhammering on the street directly outside (apologized sincerely and allowed late check-out so I could sleep in). Loved, loved, loved the location! Be sure to get sweets or the full breakfasts from Sugar Cafe, a couple blocks down on Houston. The room: Liked the design and feel of the room- comfy and clean. Bathroom was spacious, but I may have been in the wheelchair-accesible room. A/C unit worked well. Nice desk space and chair, which I used for hours doing work on my laptop. Great lighting- good range from well-lit to subtle. The bad: I stayed in the worst room in the hotel, room 701-- other reviewers also wrote about the basement (rooms labeled in the 700s). Room 701 is a queen-bed with a window that is at low-street-level (you can see feet walking by) placed directly next to the front door facing Houston St. It feels/sounds like the window is not sealed, or maybe it's the a/c unit, because the street noise is unbelievable loud. The curtains were old and inadequate-- you can see into the room from the street! I had to jerry-rig some towels for privacy. Wifi reception in my room was extremely low to none, but was high-speed with the network cable. Cordless phone didn't work- but who uses that anyway? No fridge. Despite these negatives, I would absolutely stay here again ...just in a different room!

Reviews.Title: “Ask for a room off of Houston Street ...”
Reviews.Author: Esqbyday
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed recently for a weekend away from our 2-yr old son (she stayed longer for business). Like many have said, the hotel is tiny (that's why I give the hotel 3 instead of 4 stars -- that, and the noise) -- tiny front desk, tiny hallways, tiny foyer (if you can call it a foyer), and of course tiny guest rooms (not really big enough for two -- at least not two people with two suitcases). But also as others have said, the location is great -- provided your room is not on the Houston Street side of the building, where street noise is continual all weekend long. But you can walk to or Subway to everything, the Whole Foods has a great coffee bar, and the staff were very friendly/helpful. So if you're a sound sleeper and don't plan on being in your room much (and/or are a tiny person/couple), this is the perfect place for you.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION, GREAT STAFF AND AMAZING DEAL”
Reviews.Author: robin79
Reviews.Content: What can I say? It was perfect: the room very clean, the position amazing (just a few meters from the subway and in such a cool neighborhood) and the prize very competitive. The only "bad" part about the hotel is that the rooms are VERY small. We luckily got a double bed room, a must if you are travelling with someonelse. The staff at the reception is so helpful and kind!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: ssokocat
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very clean. Staff was very nice and helpful. I loved the location. I could walk to Chinatown, Little italy, Greenwich Village, etc, 1 block from a Whole Foods store which was very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, location, and unbeatable service”
Reviews.Author: ATCMC
Reviews.Content: This is a hidden gem in a great location. Very clean, but small, rooms right next to a small park. Everyone who worked at this hotel that I had contact with was incredibly friendly, helpful, and welcoming. Anthony at the front desk is hands down the best front desk person I have ever dealt with at a NYC hotel. We will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very small room”
Reviews.Author: kj2004
Reviews.Content: The room was very small. We were very disappointed we had such a difficult time getting around because it was so crowded even with 2 bags of luggage. It does have your own air/heat control, which was nice, it was a block from the Subway which was also nice, but only one subway train from uptown-Times Square area actually stopped on 2nd street near the hotel, so if the train was not availiable or down you had to walk a few blocks back to the hotel. We also noticed that you could hear lots of traffic noise, but maybe that is in all hotels, I'm not sure, it just seemed like we heard alot of it. Pros: Our room was always cleaned when we got back with fresh towels/our bed sheets made Our bed was one of the most comfortable and we slept well, we had a queen bed too Staff was very helpful and nice Next to a Whole Foods store which was pretty cool,easy to access the cafe above or any drinks/coffee Overall the hotel was okay, we think we would have rather stayed closer to Times Square since that's where we spent most of our time and had to travel everyday by subway to get to Times Square

Reviews.Title: “Small, but cozy, isolated but near the subway”
Reviews.Author: alexmatos1979
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the hotel on Canada Day/Independance Day weekend (July 1st - July 4th). Our initial day was stressful as we missed our flight and arrived the next morning only to find that our room had been sold and we had to wait, even though our reservation was from the Wednesday night and had been paid for already via expedia. We were extremely upset and tired, to say the least. Jose was very helpful, Anthony as well. The rest of our stay was enjoyable. The neighbourhood was cool, near the subway, so we did a little bit of everything. Jessica was also helpful in getting my wife the shoes she forget after we left.

Reviews.Title: “The Gem hotel - where saints work”
Reviews.Author: SolVoyce
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfriend were in New York for five nights and had made reservations for a room in Midtown. The hotel was the worst you could ever imagine with bedbugs, mice etc... After two nights we decided to leave, and searched for a new place to stay. It wasn't easy to find a room without breaking our budget, but we found a room at the Gem hotel in soho, and booked it. Two hours later our taxi pulled up in front of the hotel. We were tired and sad from the hotel experience in Midtown, and were welcomed by the most wonderful staff you could ever imagine. The manager and a man called Mark (i think) chatted to us, and were so friendly. We got a room on the fifth floor, and when we stepped into the room we started crying. It was so nice, clean with a lovely view over Houston street and the park outside. We were so happy about the room and hotel, we wrote a letter to the cleaners about how grateful we were. When we came back to the room the following day, the manager had written us the sweetest reply. The service at this hotel is beyond everything. The staff is so incredibly nice and helpful. One night we were looking for a place to eat dinner, and Anthony at the front desk was amazing. He made reservations at a fabulous restaurant, printed us maps and was an angel. All the staff we met are truly saints. They made our NYC-stay so nice after the first two nights at the dump in Midtown. The room was lovely as well as the location, just near to a subway-stop on the F-line. My boyfriend and I loved the city, and will return as soon as possible. We will return to The Gem in soho every time we go. We really can't think of a better place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel with a superb staff”
Reviews.Author: MagneSweden
Reviews.Content: The Gem is truly a gem. It is located in Soho, close to two subway stations and many restaurants. The staff is really friendly and helpful, and the rooms are very clean and fresh! And I don't think that the rooms are to small as some say, they are perfectly fine! I went there with my girlfriend, and the rooms was perfect. We got great advice for a seafood restaurant by Anthony at the front desk. Thanks! We will stay at The Gem when we're coming to New York again, there is no doubt about it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in an ideal location for discovering the city”
Reviews.Author: Ner0n
Reviews.Content: The hotel is conveniently located on East Houston, a main artery that bisects midtown. As a result you can reach the trendy shopping areas of SoHo within a few walking minutes, West Village, East Village, main areas of interest such as Little Italy, Chinatown, Broadway south, etc.etc. The 2nd Avenue Subway is just outside the hotel, so access to uptown is easy on the F and V lines if i recall correctly. The drawback on the convenient location is of course the noise from the traffic below...particularly the never-ending ambulance sirens. But a good pair of earplugs help pretty much anywhere in Manhattan. My biggest likes: Friendly and attentive reception staff, impeccably clean rooms every day, comfortable bed (if a bit short for my 6'3"), ipod dock with radio, modern design without being overly pretentious, big flat-screen tv, and free Wifi!!! Small dislikes: windows are fixed and therefore the only way to get air into the room is to turn the AC on...which i dont favour as it gives me a dry throat every time! The second drawback with this is that the AC is very noisy and rattly. My cousin staying in a separate room to ours had a more modern unit, but same noise issue. Rooms are very small, but i knew this when booking and know that space in Manhattan comes at a premium so got used to it and wasn't too bothered! My overall rating is very good because i know it is easy to do way worse in terms of short-term accommodation in a big city. The GEM SoHo was a pleasant place to come back to after busy days and nights discovering New York City. I booked 4 nights in this hotel via an internet-based booking system and got a good deal on the double rooms we stayed in. 93EUR a night is not bad for Manhattan by any account. Making the same reservation direct with the hotel would have set me back by double the amount.

Reviews.Title: “Horrendous: Can't be worse”
Reviews.Author: Inna10
Reviews.Content: I have never been in a hotel like that one and have never known that hotels like this exist these days. We had a special occasion to celebrate and booked 2 rooms. Both rooms were in the basement ( the room numbers were deceiving, starting with 7), and the management rejected to change the rooms. The explanation "first come ..." did not work because the group of people that arrived after us were not placed in the basement. The first night in the damp dungeon was horrific : Just do not have words to describe the experience and the insult. The next day we were "upgraded" to upper floors... but the sheets have not been changed. Mine had a fresh blood stain... We had to spend FOUR nights there...

Reviews.Title: “The cleaning staff stole my ipod!”
Reviews.Author: travel155
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the GEM Soho for 4 nights and at first everything seemed great. The staff was friendly and everything was good for the first 3 nights.. The last night I came back to the room and my IPOD was missing. WE asked one of the cleaning ladies if she had seen it.. she kindly let us know that some of the new cleaning staff will often hide your valuables in the room so that you can't find them when you leave.. if its left behind they get to keep it. We started searching the room (under the beds, behind the desk, bathroom, etc) but our search came up empty. As we were making a complaint at the front desk, there was another couple there to complain that her gold necklace had been stolen from the room next to ours. The staff at the hotel did not apologize, they were immediately defensive (I guess this happens alot). Coming from a smaller city, it was my mistake in assuming that nothing would be stolen from the hotel room. The only answer I got from the manager was" why didnt you use the safe in the room" .... I then asked her who else had a key to my room besides me.. she replied. "the staff". I hope the lady who stole it really needed it. Lock EVERYTHING you want to keep in the safe.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location!”
Reviews.Author: jackiejelly
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Gem for 6 nights and frankly wished we had stayed there for all 11 nights we had in NY. The location was perfect! Walking distance to major shopping in Soho, stone's throw to subway and all the night life East Village has to offer! Oh, and how could I forget about the interesting little shops and galleries in Lower East Side. As for the hotel itself, the staff were very friendly and helpful,especially Anthony and Paolo. The room was spotless and the beds were super comfy. We were lucky to get a great rate for Gem thru Expedia so for us this was a fantastic stay in a fantastic city!

Reviews.Title: “So so....”
Reviews.Author: WencheG
Reviews.Content: The room was ok. We liked the beds a lot and the rooms interior and surfaces seemed to have been refurbished in recent years. But some basic things seemed to us to be older. Our toilet was clogged twice, and because the hotels policy seemed to be that the problem would only be fixed only when the maids did their usual daily rounds, we had to do without a toilet until the evening the following day, which was a long time to be without a toilet. There were plungers standing ready in the staircase, so I am guessing we weren't the only ones having this problem. The hairdryer would only work for a couple of minutes before turning itself off. And the wi-fi was veeeery slow. The hotel rooms are generally small in NY, and this hotel seemed no better and no worse in that respect. With regards to the service at this hotel, opinions vary. We had a bad experience with one of the staff, and even though this is not generally something we care much about, this time it actually affected our overall hotelexperience quite a lot. But most of the staff seemed normal, average we would say. So maybe other guest will have better luck... We liked the area, and the proximity to areas like Soho, Nolita, Lower Eastside and West Village would be the primary reason to choose this hotel. Be aware that Houston Street has a lot of traffic, and even our room, which was on the fourth floor and facing the park, you did hear the heavy traffic from the street below very well. And be warned: they have rooms in the basement, with windows that are right on the pavement, and the aircondition is placed in the middle of the window and covers most of it. These rooms are dark, dingy and noisy. If you pay full standard rate on this hotel, we would say the price/value ratio is not good.

Reviews.Title: “The Gem is a great little hotel!”
Reviews.Author: AnnArborSusan
Reviews.Content: Hadn't been to NY in 25 years and had no idea where to stay, but was on a budget and wanted Soho area. The Gem was truly a "gem" and helped make our 4 days in NY fabulous! The staff was very helpful, printing out maps for us, giving directions, suggestions, etc. Of course the room small, but we expected that, and very clean. My only "complaint" is that the wireless internet did not always work. Bathroom was a decent size, and the bed and pillows were super comfortable. After pounding the pavement all day long enjoying the city, this little hotel provided a good night's sleep, and that's really all we wanted it for. If you're going to spend a lot of time in the room then you need to pay for something bigger and more luxurious For those who simply want a clean, inviting place to get ready for the day and sleep at night, the Gem is perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: cw19_86
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through Expedia for a stay in March 2010 and thoroughly enjoyed my stay. I arrived about an hour and a half before the 3pm check in, but the staff were happy to store my luggage until I could whilst I went off to explore the neighbourhood and get something to eat at The National Underground a block east - they have delicious burgers. Returning at 3pm to check in I was very pleased with my room on the 5th floor (which was quite a good size) close to the junction of Forsyth & East Houston overlooking Sara D Roosevelt Park. I had a few issues in that the bed was bigger than the mattress, so I caught my leg on the corner of the wooden base a couple of times - but quickly learnt my lesson. The bed however, was extremely comfortable and I found that the pillow mist that appeared three days in greatly aided me to get to sleep as the white blinds did little to block out the sunlight when you come in at 4am and are getting to sleep as the sun comes up - the curtains are just for show. The TV didn't pick up a lot of the channels, but you don't come to New York to stay in watching the television - it was just background noise whilst I was getting ready to go out. Other than that, I was very happy - I was only really in the room from 4am to 10am, popping in to get changed in the early evening before going out again - it was comfortable, in a great location and I felt safe, plus I felt my belongings were safe. The staff were extremely helpful - I had some issues with my room card, but was told it was likely because I'd kept them in the same pocket as my mobile phone - moving them solved the issue. I wasn't told what the pebble was for, but I'd read about it on Trip Advisor - so put it on my bed halfway through my 10 night stay and returned to find that my sheets had been changed as requested. I also wasn't made aware of the charges for the safe, they appeared on my credit card statement afterwards, having to contact the hotel to query what they were for - but the rate was very reasonable and I was happy to pay for the service given the peace of mind it gave me. Maybe 'A guide to your stay' card should be added to each room explaining about these. Overall The Gem is a great hotel, the free WiFi was a big plus - it always worked and the speed was excellent, the staff were friendly & helpful and the location made it easy to get to wherever I wanted to go - the subway station is a block down for F & V trains. Perhaps it's a little expensive for what it is, but all hotels in the LES seem to be which I find surprising in comparison to some of the more touristy locations. I'd definitely stay here again though as the nightlife is great - I'd recommend that anyone staying at the Gem also visits the National Underground, it's a great place to be at night and is within easy walking distance to & from the hotel - handy if you've indulged in a few drinks!

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly Adequate”
Reviews.Author: Horseymama
Reviews.Content: I stayed here over Spring break with my 9 yr. old son. We enjoyed the hotel, and of course the area is super. Our room was small, normal for NYC, but very clean and we had a huge window with a great view of the street and the park next door. The beds and pillows were comfortable, the only complaint is that the door was hard to open and close as it appeared they had just installed new carpet and the door didn't quite fit. I thought the staff was very friendly. I got a good deal at the time through Expedia. We went to New York to visit friends and see the city so we didn't spend a lot of time in the room, but we did use it a bit as my son needed some naps and down time and I felt it was perfectly comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Do not listen to other bad reviews - This place is great”
Reviews.Author: NatalieBibbey
Reviews.Content: I myself work in the hotel industry and have done for the past 6 years and therefore I am always quite critical when I stay in other hotels. I want to stress to anyone reading do not listen to some of the other things people have commented on below... This place is great. Yes the hotel is small, but this is New York and unless you want to pay over $250 a night you are not going to get anywhere large. The rooms have everyhting you need, comfy beds, clean soft sheets and nice bathrooms with a great hot shower. The room was cleaned everyday and the towels always changed. The sheets on the bed are changed when you leave a rock on the bed which you are informed about on check in,this is due to the fact the hotel is trying to go green which really is something everyone should get on board with.... I mean really who at home changes their sheets on a daily basis!!!! It is in a great loction with the subway close by, and it has a lot and I mean alot of friendly bars and restaurants within a 2/3 minute walk, and you get a real feel from these places, thay are not full of tourist as with the midtown hangouts they seem to be full of local groups of frinds out for a good night. I recommend Sugar bar from breakfast and Mole and Oliva for dinner. The staff were friendly and helped us with recommendations and really seemed happy to help, the maids were also chatty and friendly. I really do recommend this place for travellers looking for something good that will not break the bank, also the area is great if you dont want to be surrounded by tourists and expensive tourist bars. I will be staying here next time a travel to NYC and will be recommending it to anyone who goes.

Reviews.Title: “warning tape on the front door should be installed”
Reviews.Author: sushiskynyc
Reviews.Content: the room was never cleaned and was made to look like it had been cleaned. they put back used soap and they made the bed very beautifully with used sheets. we realized too late and then they still told us they could not get the housekeepers in. we did get clean sheets to change the bed ourselves. they also gave us two (of three) nights free. but it was a hassle. will never stay again. it is an expensive hotel with cheap practices.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible”
Reviews.Author: travelingmares
Reviews.Content: The only thing good about this place is the location - easily accesible to Soho and Lower East Side. There is virtually no lobby, no good help in terms of conceirges or check-in and no place to park to unload your car. I booked my room through Quikbook. Thank goodness I had the print-out for my reservation because, without the print-out, they were going to charge me $430 (almost $150 more than what I paid). This place, I think, used to be a Howard Johnson's, and I still felt like I was staying in one. The electronic keys weren't working, the tv was out of service and there is no place to hang more than 2 articles of clothing in the room. The mustard-colored blanket on the bed looked soiled and gross. All in all, terrible, and I still can't believe I paid what I did for the hotel (even in NYC).

Reviews.Title: “Adequate hotel but AMAZING location”
Reviews.Author: jonnytekno
Reviews.Content: This isn't the best hotel I've ever stayed in by any means: the rooms are very small; the staff are a tiny bit miserable; the wi-fi is rubbish. However, it is clean and comfortable and above all else in a FANTASTIC location. The reason I booked it was because of others comments about the location, but now I've been I can see why - if you are in New York to eat and drink and generally hang out then there isn't a better place. The Lower East Side and East and West Villages have the best bar/restaurant scene in New York and are all within walking distance (depending how cold it is) - plus there is a metro station and Whole Foods Market within spitting distance.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, great location, love the Lower East Side”
Reviews.Author: neko23
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, very friendly, room bigger than we expected for the price (2 double beds), clean, quiet, fridge & microwave - & great location too. Perfect for getting to everywhere, & great places to eat/drink in easy walking distance, Katz's Deli, the Elephant (great Thai-ish food, great mojitos) on E 1st Street, the Puck Fair on Lafayette...the Lower East Side rules!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: ZiggyIreland
Reviews.Content: Overall, i was so disappointed with this hotel. We expected it to be small, considering most NY hotel are, but this was particularly bad, we had nowhere even to put our cases! Our room did not get cleaned for the first couple of days, we asked at reception three times, they promised us it would get cleaned but eventually admitted that it wouldnt and they told us they were too busy as the hotel was full. This is no excuse, get more staff! The next day we asked again and eventually someone came to clean the room, and lets just say, i still wouldnt call it clean! They never vacuumed the room or even mopped the bathroom floor, yet they would leave all the clean towels on the floor. The tv didnt work properly and there was constantly a line going across the top of the screen and a buzzing noise from it. There were no curtains, just a blind, which meant that there was always a draught coming in, the room was freezing at night as the heater they had in the room was very noisy and the heat would blow you away! On our last night, we had very noisy neighbours, walls were like paper! The only good thing i have to say about the hotel was Courtney. He was very helpful and polite and he always tried to do whatever he could, not like the other staff at the hotel. I will never stay here again and i will definitely not be recommending this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Pretty coffin”
Reviews.Author: TessaWainscott
Reviews.Content: The GEM was not a good experience for me. There is virtually no lobby and no way to unload your bags from a car...no place to park nearby. They did not know the location of parking lots, had no shower caps, the door to my room barely closed because of the new carpeting and would open at a strong shove...the window didn't open and it was so small and claustrophobic with recycled air. The fan was noisy and didn't seem to bring in fresh air. The room smelled bad, like stale air. It was decorated nicely and was clean, otherwise. The Wi-Fi didn't work and their computer system was down all day. The air was so bad in the room I had to check out at 1 am and go somewhere else as I felt I was suffocating.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT location, HELPFULL staff”
Reviews.Author: Yockopoe
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located just on the corner of SoHo, Litte Italy and the Lower East Side, superb location if you want to stay miles away from Midtown, the double deck buses, group tourists and musicals. The staff is more than helpfull, kind and always with a smile. Room are extremely small (as almost everywhere else in NY) but we got a standard with the lowest rate ever on agoda.com so paying a little more for a superior can bring you a little wider surface. Room 101 201 301 401... are very noisy because of E Houston St, but a pair of earplug can bring back peace and confort. The bed and lines are superb, the bathroom is wide, clean and with nice amenities. There's a Wholefood Market just in front (together with metro station) so it's easy and nice to come back from a long day walking in NY and having some fresh fruit or a juice or whatever else. The area is great you can walk 5 minutes and have all the shopping and bars and restaurants you may like. i would definitively reccomend this to a joung couple who wants to enjoy the less touristic NY, cannot effort a 500usd room and want to enjoy night.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location, free wireless, accommodating staff”
Reviews.Author: washoegood
Reviews.Content: The GEM Hotel on Houston used to be a Howard Johnson's but you'd never know it from the rooms. The beds were so comfy we both overslept! The wireless was free and actually worked. No mini-bar, but Katz's Deli is just down the street. If you want a quiet room ask for one that faces Forsythe Street. If you want a room with two beds you'll automatically get one that's quiet.

Reviews.Title: “A very positive experience”
Reviews.Author: BDell
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Gem Soho for 3 nights. Check in to check out was a pleasant experience. The room was neat and clean with wonderful coffee. There was a microwave and a nice size refrigerator to put your stash from Whole Foods which is a block away. The subway is also a block away. There is a nice park next to the hotel. The employees were great! Nice robes in the room. Nice towels in the bathroom. Really an exceptional place for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Glad I chose to stay here!”
Reviews.Author: eggysnonna
Reviews.Content: I was very pleased with the GEM SoHo. The location is great if the hustle and bustle of midtown is not what you are looking for. Houston is busy, but I felt very relaxed once I got into my room. The atmosphere in the GEM is cozy and quiet. I did wear earplugs to sleep, but the outside noise really wasn't that bad. The front desk staff are very friendly, helpful and courteous. It was nice to be greeted with a smile every day. The room was small, but clean and comfy. The bed and linens were top-notch. It was great to have the fridge and microwave. The hotel is just across the street from Whole Foods, a small park, and tons of excellent little restaurants. Don't miss Russ & Daughters just down Houston for an amazing bagel, lox and cream cheese breakfast. I did not miss room service at all, and felt I benefited from trying the unique local spots in the neighborhood. My friends stayed in midtown in a big chain hotel and paid lots more for the fancy trimmings, but I was very happy with this little place in the village. A big chain hotel is the same anywhere, but the GEM made for a unique experience. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “One sweet hotel!”
Reviews.Author: moxiemoo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the GEM for one night for a wedding. Hotel is located right on the edge of Soho in a lively part of town, directly above the NY institution, Yonah Schimmel's Knishes, and convenient walking distance to the East Village, Little Italy, and Chinatown. The rooms, hallways and lobby are all quite COMPACT but nicely appointed, and as accommodating as they can be given the tight quarters. Staff were very friendly & helpful, including holding our bags for several hours in the small office. We reserved one room with 2 beds but were reassigned to 2 rooms on the same floor (not adjacent) which worked out fine and ended up being a big bargain (we were charged the single room rate, as is appropriate). Room appointments were lovely & I wish I could have enjoyed the room more - we were out at our event for the bulk of the time. Nice shower, toiletries, coffee, fridge/microwave, and very comfy beds, linens, and bathrobes. Poor sleepers should note that Houston Street is ALWAYS noisy. Bring earplugs. Also, for those traveling by car - and good luck traveling by car in lower Manhattan - there is no parking, but many commercial parking garages around. The staff recommended one east of the hotel, but we found parking on Elizabeth St. just north of Houston and it worked out great. I would happily give 5 stars except for a few modest issues: one room's door did NOT want to latch shut, so we had to use the deadbolt simply to close the door; the same room had a sketchy bathroom light switch; and - worst - we were at first assigned to a room that was already occupied. Big no-no, mitigated by the fact it was occupied by other people attending the same event (but not known to us). No one likes to be getting changed & have a stranger walk into their hotel room!! That said, this was an great value for an elegant and comfortable hotel experience. I would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the price”
Reviews.Author: BeverlyS
Reviews.Content: My room was indeed very small, but had everything I needed. The room was clean and surprisingly quiet given the location, with a very very comfortable bed. The staff were very friendly and helpful and the location is absolutely perfect, being Lower East Side but spitting distance from SoHo and the East Village. The Gem isn't fancy but it's good for the price, and it's hard to find affordable hotels in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Best boutique hotel in NYC!!!”
Reviews.Author: Soccer_Dad_and_Son
Reviews.Content: Unreal location! Right in the heart of Soho, walk to Little Italy, China town etc. The hotel rooms are very chic and larger than 90% of roms in NYC...great staff and close to everything we were looking for. I was in-town for a concert and spent 3 nights here and all I can say is WOW. The hotel looked brand new, had the ambiance of a W but with unmistakable feel of a B&B...unique combo and combined with the location it truly is a GEM. I am planning another trip to NYC in the next couple of months and will look no futher than the GEM (and no I do not work for the Hotel; I am a real customer who was truly impressed and i feel I need to rave about a hotel when i have been blown away). Also, forgot to mention the service; we arrived late, after 1am, and received a warm greeting by the night auditor. He suggested a few great places in the area and everyone was spot on. The day staff was equally as helpful and had maps already made up for the key points we wanted to visit. What more can I say, I LOVED THIS HOTEL! A+ to The GEM...I will be back...keep up the good work!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: fatbobOrlando
