Reviews.Content: Picked the Gem because of the location and the reviews here on TA. Super value for New York, VERY helpful staff. Small room was quite, newer furnishing and well maintained. Close to subway and bus with plenty of eating and drinking establishments near by. You really can't go wrong choosing this GEM.

Reviews.Title: “Five Stars”
Reviews.Author: MRonsonMark
Reviews.Content: Newyorkcity is definitely one of my favorite cities in the world, and this hotel goes hand by hand with the city, except you can sleep until late

Reviews.Title: “We loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: dougieoscar
Reviews.Content: Having been to New york several times before and always staying midtown, we decided on a change! This hotel is perfect in everyway, the area is fab, within walking distance to all the downtown areas. The F and V subway lines are just across the road so everything in the whole of New York is easily accessable. The staff on the desk were very friendly (such a change for us, usually the most we get is a grunt in midtown!!...oops!!) The room itself was good, very comfy bed, flat screen plasma, ipod dock, free wifi internet, nice bed linen, clean bathroom, fridge and microwave!! We enjoyed Sugar for brekkie and the italian in Wholefoods was pretty awesome too!! Love, love, loved it!!!

Reviews.Title: “Top value and location”
Reviews.Author: gingerau
Reviews.Content: Okay, so it's not really in SoHo, but I was very pleasantly surprised by the quality of this Gem hotel, particularly at the lowlow price we booked it for online. The rooms are small but big enough for two not-petite people; the amenities are basic but what's there is very good (so there's no cafe or room service or you do get Wolfgang Puck coffee for your in-room percolater); and the reception and housekeeping staff were universally cheerful, welcoming and happy to help. Plus, the bed was so comfortable we actually asked what kind it was so we can get one for home! I think the location is actually better for tourists than being in the middle of SoHo, because you're so close to all the great downtown neighbourhoods - we could easily walk to SoHo, Nolita and East and West villages for drinks and dinner every night - plus there's a Wholefoods supermarket over the road, it's close to at least two subway stations and if you're really feeling lazy there are bars and restaurants within the same block (I heartily recommend trying a knish from the place next door if you need a stodgy hangover cure).

Reviews.Title: “perfect surroundings”
Reviews.Author: denimpsycho
Reviews.Content: everything was perfect from the location to the service to the well designed room. the staff was pleasant and helpful in every way. the room was clean and appeared to be recently renovated with large flat screen tv's and an incredibly comfortable bed. this is the perfect spot for easy access to shopping, dining, drinking and exploring. i would definitley stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing staff and location”
Reviews.Author: shalak
Reviews.Content: The rooms are small but they are neat and well maintained. Room size is not really an issue anyway since hotel is smack in the border of the Lower East Side and East Village and there's so much to do. Any issue with room size is more than compensated by excellent staff and the fantastic location. The staff were just wonderful - smart, very friendly and went out of their way to help. I would stay here again, tomorrow.

Reviews.Title: “very helpful staff,clean room,decent price”
Reviews.Author: bikeboy58
Reviews.Content: smallish room but very clean.helpful,personable staff.lots of good stuff nearby

Reviews.Title: “great value for the dollar”
Reviews.Content: Terrific location. Very clean room that appeared to have been updated recently, including crisp linens, very clean bathroom, flat screen TV. Friendly/helpful staff. Small room, but its NYC - you're only in the room to sleep/shower.

Reviews.Title: “Insanely good price- great location-wonderful staff-will stay again and again”
Reviews.Author: dakotahblu
Reviews.Content: I stayed 2 nights at the Gem Soho (not really anywhere near SoHo) 13 &14 March. I was in NYC for a music festival that was held 2 blocks down the street. What can I say. I spent $145 a night in Manhatten. GREAT DEAL! Lovely room, small, but expected. CLEAN. Incredible front of house staff who were funny, kind, helpful and seemed to really enjoy working at this hotel. We had a room facing the park, street noise wasn't anymore than I would expect from a hotel on a street as busy as Houston. You can walk anywhere from here. Very convienient to subway stops. *Only complaint, they ran out of coffee packets for in room service and only had decaf. ummm, nope, that wasn't so cool. No coffee for the whole stay. Though plenty of great cafes within blocks. I also wish the drapes could have closed to add more room darkening. The pull down shade didn't quite black out. I am not complaining though. I will stay there again and again for the good rates, the wonderful staff, immaculate rooms, and great location. GOOD JOB GUYS! (also if you are there visit the Local 269 a great pub just a couple blocks away at 269 E. Houston. You will be made to feel at home here.) The GEM SoHo is a hidden gem. Hopefully the next time I will be able to get such a great rate!- Oooh, also right next door is a knishery, super yummy!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Deal”
Reviews.Author: BluesChick2
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great for the price. The only fault I found in it was the street nose (honking horns) which I realize is hard to avoid in NYC. I would recommend a room on a higher floor. I was on the second floor. The room was on the smaller side but was average size by NYC standards. I was expecting the room to be much smaller. My dad and I had more than enough room. The staff was extremely friendlly and accomodating. We arrived at 10am. Check in is at 3pm. They held our bags in the office for us. Not sure if it was locked up but we didn't have any valuables so we weren't too worried. It's a really great location. One block from the subway. We were able to walk to many of the places we were visiting. It's about a ten minute walk to Lombardi's Pizza in Little Italy (don't miss it!). It's about two blocks away from Katz's Deli (overpriced). It's a great hotel expecially considering you mostlly sleep and shower in a hotel when you're in NYC.
